summary: the prevalence of pneumocystis pneumonia (PCP) and associated hypoxic respiratory failure is increasing in human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-negative patients. no prior studies have evaluated the effect of early anti-PCP treatment on clinical outcomes in HIV-negative patients with PCP who presented in respiratory failure. Supplementary information 12931_2019_1188_MOESM1_ESM.docx (25KB, docx) Additional file 1. Table S1. Comparison of baseline characteristics of 51 patients according to the quartiles of time to anti-PCP treatment.
